Publication Title: 3D genome mapping identifies subgroup-specific chromosome conformations and tumor-dependency genes in ependymoma
Publication Authors: Konstantin Okonechnikov, Aylin Camgöz, Owen Chapman, Sameena Wani, Donglim Esther Park, Jens-Martin Hübner, Abhijit Chakraborty, Meghana Pagadala, Rosalind Bump, Sahaana Chandran, Katerina Kraft, Rocio Acuna-Hidalgo, Derek Reid, Kristin Sikkink, Monika Mauermann, Edwin F Juarez, Anne Jenseit, James T Robinson, Kristian W Pajtler, Till Milde, Natalie Jäger, Petra Fiesel, Ling Morgan, Sunita Sridhar(Read more on Pubmed)
Publication Abstract: Ependymoma is a tumor of the brain or spinal cord. The two most common and aggressive molecular groups of ependymoma are the supratentorial ZFTA-fusion associated and the posterior fossa ependymoma group A. In both groups, tumors occur mainly in young children and frequently recur after treatment.
